Base.Explanation: Get the value of an attribute of an Active Directory object, for instance a user account. The attribute is specified by the LDAP display name of the attribute. For the most common properties, the LDAP name can be selected from a list.

ArrayElement.Name: User Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a user account. If you want to obtain the property of a user account object, you can use this property to specify the Active Directory object for this action. Use the action 'Get user (AD)' to find the user account in Active Directory and setup the variable that contains the 'User Object'.

ArrayElement.Name: Active Directory Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing a Active Directory object for which an attribute must obtained. This property can only be used as a input variable. Earlier in the script, another script action must have generated the value for this variable.

ArrayElement.Name: LDAP attribute display name
ArrayElement.Description: The LDAP name of the attribute. The name identifies the attribute of the Active Directory object. For a number of well-known attributes, the LDAP name can be selected from a list but you can specify any other valid name.

ArrayElement.Name: Multi-value flag
ArrayElement.Description: Save multi-values as multi-values for the attribute. If set to 'Yes' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are stored as multi-values (text list or table). If set to 'No' and the attribute is multi-valued, the values are converted into a single value. Default value: 'No'.

ArrayElement.Name: Convert to text flag
ArrayElement.Description: Convert the value(s) of the attribute to text. Default value: 'Yes'. If set, depending on property 'Multi-value flag', the result is either a single text or text list. If not set ('No'), the results is stored as one of the UMRA supported data types.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if no attribute found
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the specified attribute is not found.

ArrayElement.Name: Error if empty
ArrayElement.Description: Generate an error for this script action if the attribute is found but attribute value is empty.

ArrayElement.Name: Attribute value
ArrayElement.Description: The value found for the attribute. This property is an 'output only' property and is generated by the application automatically. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %AttributeValue%.

Base.Explanation: Manage the mail addresses for a user, contact or group. With this action you cannot create or manage an Exchange 2003/2000 mailbox. Instead, you can setup E-mail addresses for existing user accounts and contacts.

ArrayElement.Name: AD Object
ArrayElement.Description: A data structure representing the Active Directory object for which you want to manage the E-mail addresses. The property is used to identifiy the mail recipient: a user account, contact or group and must be generated as a variable by a previous script action ('Creating user (AD), Create contact (AD), Get object (AD), Get user (AD)').

ArrayElement.Name: Target address
ArrayElement.Description: The property specifies the delivery address to which e-mail for this recipient should be sent. By specifying this property, mail is automatically enabled for the recipient. If you specify this property, you should not specify property 'Disable mail'.

ArrayElement.Name: Disable mail
ArrayElement.Description: With this property you can disable mail to the recipient. The recipient can be a user, folder, contact, or group. If you set this property to 'Yes', the recipient can no longer receive mail. All mail addresses are cleared. You should not set both this property and property 'Target address'. If you do not set either of these properties, the recipient mail enabled status is not changed.

ArrayElement.Name: Alias
ArrayElement.Description: Optional: The Alias property specifies the alias used for E-mail address generation. By default, E-mail addresses are generated based on the name of the user account.

ArrayElement.Name: E-mail addresses
ArrayElement.Description: Optional: The E-mail addresses specified for the recipient. By default, the E-mail addresses are generated automatically (see also property 'Auto-update E-mail addresses'). By specifying this property you can configure additional E-mail addresses.

ArrayElement.Name: Auto-update E-mail addresses
ArrayElement.Description: The E-mail addresses for the Exchange mailbox can be generated according to the recipient's policy by specifying this option.

ArrayElement.Name: Hide from address book
ArrayElement.Description: The property specifies whether the recipient is displayed in the address book. Default value: 'No'.

ArrayElement.Name: Restrict receiving message size
ArrayElement.Description: Set to 'Yes' if you want to limit the size of messages received by this recipient.

ArrayElement.Name: Maximum receiving message size
ArrayElement.Description: Specifies the maximum size, in kilobytes, of a message sent to this recipient.

ArrayElement.Name: Restrict sending message size
ArrayElement.Description: Set to 'Yes' if you want to limit the size of messages sent by the user or group. This property can only be specified for Active Directory objects with a mailbox.

ArrayElement.Name: Maximum sending message size
ArrayElement.Description: Specifies the maximum size, in kilobytes, of a message that the user or group can send. This property can only be specified for Active Directory objects with a mailbox.

Base.Explanation: Edit the attributes of a mail enabled user by specifying the properties.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The Identity parameter identifies the mail enabled user. Use for example the distinguished name (CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com), the domain\account name (tools4ever.com\Jsmith), the alias (JSmith), the User principal name (JSmith@tools4ever.com) or the GUID.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from
Base.Description: The 'Accept messages only from' parameter specifies the mailbox users, mail users and mail contacts that can send e-mail messages to this mailbox. The AcceptMessagesOnlyFrom parameter can take any of the following examples: the distinguished name (CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com), the domain\account name (tools4ever.com\Jsmith), the username (JohnSmith), the alias (JSmith), the display name (John Smith), the User principal name (JSmith@tools4ever.com) or the GUID. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Alias
Base.Description: The Alias parameter specifies the alias of the user. The alias can be a combination of characters separated by a period with no intervening spaces. Do not use special characters in the alias.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 1
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 1' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute1.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 2
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 2' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute2.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 3
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 3' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute3.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 4
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 4' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute4.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 5
Base.Description: The 'Custom attribute 5' parameter specifies the value for the mailbox attribute CustomAttribute5.

Base.Name: Display name
Base.Description: The 'Display name' parameter specifies the display name of the user.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller used to retrieve the data from Active Directory directory service. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example: EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com.

Base.Name: Email addresses
Base.Description: The 'Email addresses' parameter can be used to specify the e-mail alias of the mail user. All valid Microsoft Exchange 2007 e-mail address types may be used. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Emailaddress policy enabled
Base.Description: The 'Emailaddress policy enabled' parameter specifies whether the e-mail address policy for this mailbox is enabled.

Base.Name: External email address
Base.Description: The 'External email address' parameter specifies whether the e-mail addresses for the mailbox will be automatically updated based on the e-mail address policies defined. When this parameter is set to 'Yes', the 'Primary SMTP address' or 'Windows email address' parameters cannot be changed.

Base.Name: Grant send on behalf to
Base.Description: The 'Grant send on behalf to' parameter specifies the distinguished name (DN) of recipients that can send messages on behalf of this user.

Base.Name: Hidden from addresslists enabled
Base.Description: The 'Hidden from addresslists enabled' parameter specifies whether the user appears in the address lists.

Base.Name: Maximum receive size
Base.Description: The 'Maximum receive size' parameter specifies the maximum size of e-mail messages that can be received by the mail user, from 1 kilobyte (KB) to 2,097,151 KB. If not specified, there will be no size restrictions. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited".

Base.Name: Maximum send size
Base.Description: The 'Maximum send size' parameter specifies the maximum size of e-mail messages that can be sent by the mail user, from 1 KB to 2,097,151 KB. If not specified, there will be no size restrictions. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited".

Base.Name: Name
Base.Description: The 'Name' parameter specifies the name of the user.

Base.Name: Primary SMTP address
Base.Description: The 'Primary SMTP address' parameter specifies the address that external users will see when they receive a message from this mailbox. If this parameter is used, the 'Email addresses' parameter cannot be used because 'Email addresses' includes the primary SMTP address.

Base.Name: Recipient limits
Base.Description: The 'Recipient limits' parameter specifies the maximum number of recipients for messages from this user. Specify either an integer or "unlimited." If this attribute is set on a mailbox, it overrides the default value that is set for this attribute on the hub transport server.

Base.Name: Reject messages from
Base.Description: The 'Reject messages from' parameter specifies the recipients from whom messages will be rejected. Use for example: domain.com/Sales/JSmith. Use commas to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Require sender authentication enabled
Base.Description: The 'RequireSenderAuthenticationEnabled' parameter specifies whether senders must be authenticated.

Base.Name: SamAccountName
Base.Description: The 'SamAccountName' parameter defines the logon name used to support clients and servers running older versions of the operating system, such as Microsoft Windows NT 4.0, Windows 98, Windows 95, and LAN Manager. This parameter must be less than 20 characters in length.

Base.Name: Simple display name
Base.Description: The 'Simple display name' parameter is used on objects where the name of the object may be displayed in an environment that does not support Unicode characters. The only supported characters for the SimpleDisplayName parameter are ASCII characters 26 through 126, inclusively. These characters are the ones that are typically found on most U.S. English keyboards.

Base.Name: User principal name
Base.Description: The 'User principal name' parameter specifies the user principal name (UPN) for the mail user.

Base.Name: Windows emailaddress
Base.Description: The 'Windows emailaddress' parameter specifies the Windows e-mail address for this mail user. This address is not used by Exchange.

Base.Explanation: Setup a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session is requied for a number of UMRA script actions that use the Powershell Agent service. See the online help for more information.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should be stored in a variable that is used in subsequent UMRA acions thath use the Powershell Agent service session. This property is an 'output only' property. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %PowershellAgentSessionId%.

Base.Explanation: Setup an Exchange session for PowerShell to manage an Exchange 2010 server.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Connection URI
Base.Description: The Connection URI parameter specifies the location of the PowerShell. For example: 'https://[ExchangeServer].tools4ever.local/Powershell' or 'https://[ExchangeServer]/Powershell' or 'https://ps.outlook.com/powershell/'.

Base.Name: Credential User Name
Base.Description: Optional. The credential user name, use this parameter when you want to access the Exchange Server with an explicit account. The user name must be of an account inside the domain of the Exchange server and must have access to the Exchange server For example: 'tools4ever\JohnSmith'. If not specified, a default security context is tried for the specified authentication method, Generally this will be the security context of the Powershell Agent Service account.

Base.Name: Credential Password
Base.Description: Optional. The encrypted password of the account you want to use to access the Exchange server with. The input should be the encrypted value of the password.

Base.Name: Skip certificate check
Base.Description: With the 'Skip certificate check' parameter you can choose to connect to the exchange server without checking the certificate of the exchange server.

Base.Name: Skip prerequisites test
Base.Description: With the 'Skip prerequisites test' parameter you can choose to skip the check for PowerShell version, windows remoting version, execution policy. Set this only if you're completely sure the check fails, but the settings are correct.

Base.Name: Authentication
Base.Description: Specifies the mechanism that is used to authenticate the user's credentials. Valid values are "Default", "Basic", "Credssp", "Digest", "Kerberos", "Negotiate", and "NegotiateWithImplicitCredential". The default value is "Default".

Base.Name: Advanced: Logging mask
Base.Description: The mask specified here, determines the logging output of ALL the PowerShell actions in this session. Default all messages except debug messages are shown. The mask is build from the following numbers: 1 = Normal, 2 = Error, 4 = Warning, 8 = Info, 128 = Debug. If not specified the number 7 is used.

Base.Explanation: Change the properties of an existing distribution group.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller used for reading or writing configuration changes. If not specified, Exchange will determine a domain controller. To prevent replication issues always use the same domain controller in the same session. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example 'EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com'.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The identifier of the object to modify. Use for example the distinguished name 'CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com', the Windows Live Id 'jsmith@tools4everlive.com', the domain\account name 'tools4ever.com\Jsmith', the alias 'JSmith', the User principal name 'JSmith@tools4ever.com' or GUID.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from
Base.Description: The mailbox users, mail users and mail contacts that can send e-mail messages to this mailbox. Any of the following input formats is supported: the distinguished name 'CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com', the domain\account name 'tools4ever.com\Jsmith', the username 'JohnSmith', the alias 'JSmith', the display name 'John Smith', the user principal name 'JSmith@tools4ever.com' or the GUID. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from distribution list members
Base.Description: The distribution lists from which messages are accepted.. Messages from any member of these distribution lists are accepted. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: Accept messages only from senders or members
Base.Description: The identity of recipients from whom messages are accepted. Specify a text-list for this parameter.

Base.Name: Alias
Base.Description: Optional value. This parameter can be used to specify the alias of the distribution group. The Alias parameter is then used to generate the primary SMTP e-mail address of the object. The value of Alias can't contain spaces.

Base.Name: Arbitration mailbox
Base.Description: The mailbox that's used to manage the moderation process. This parameter is automatically set when blank and moderation is enabled.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 1
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute1.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 2
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute2.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 3
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute3.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 4
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute4.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 5
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute5.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 6
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute6.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 7
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute7.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 8
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute8.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 9
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute9.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 10
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute10.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 11
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute11.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 12
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute12.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 13
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute13.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 14
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute14.

Base.Name: Custom attribute 15
Base.Description: The value for the distribution group attribute CustomAttribute15.

Base.Name: Display name
Base.Description: Optional value. The distribution group's name in the Exchange Management Console and in the Exchange global address list (GAL).

Base.Name: E-Mail addresses
Base.Description: Optional value. The e-mail alias of the distribution group. All valid Microsoft Exchange Server 2010 e-mail address types may be used. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: EmailAddress policy enabled
Base.Description: Set tot 'Yes' to enable the e-mail address policy for this distribution group. Set to 'No' to disable the policy. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Expansion server
Base.Description: Optional value. The Exchange server, used to expand the distribution group. Enter the expansion server as a legacy Exchange DN value.

Base.Name: External managed
Base.Description: Optional value. Set to 'Yes' to specify that this distribution group is managed by an external application, or set to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Grant send on behalf to
Base.Description: The distinguished name 'DN' of recipients that can send messages on behalf of this distribution group. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Hidden from address lists enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to hide this distribution group from any Exchange address lists, or to 'No' to unhide this distribution group. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Mail tip
Base.Description: The message that is displayed to senders when they start drafting an e-mail message to this recipient. This message must be less than or equal to 250 characters.

Base.Name: Mail tip translations
Base.Description: The translations for the 'Mail tip' parameter. Each entry in the list must provide the locale, followed by a colon and the specific mail tip in that language. Each mail tip message must be less than or equal to 250 characters. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Managed by
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the mailbox user, mail-enabled group, or mail-enabled contact that appears in the Managed by tab of the Active Directory object. Any of the following values can be used: Distinguished name (DN), Windows Live ID, Canonical name, GUID, Name, Display name, Legacy Exchange DN and Primary SMTP e-mail address.

Base.Name: Managed by (Multiple)
Base.Description: Optional value. Use this instead of the "Managed by" property, if there are more than one manager items. Requires exchange2010 sp2 The names of the mailbox user, mail-enabled group, or mail-enabled contact that are managers of the group. Any of the following values can be used: Distinguished name (DN), Windows Live ID, Canonical name, GUID, Name, Display name, Legacy Exchange DN and Primary SMTP e-mail address. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Maximum receive size
Base.Description: The maximum allowed e-mail message size that can be sent to this distribution group. Qualify the value with one of the following: 'B' (bytes), 'KB' (kilobytes), 'MB' (megabytes), 'GB' (gigabytes) or 'unlimited'.

Base.Name: Maximum send size
Base.Description: The 'Maximum send size' parameter can be used to specify the maximum allowed e-mail message size that can be sent from this distribution group. Qualify the value with one of the following: B (bytes), KB (kilobytes), MB (megabytes), GB (gigabytes) or "unlimited".

Base.Name: Moderated By
Base.Description: The users who are responsible for moderating the messages sent to this distribution group. This parameter is required if the 'Moderation Enabled' parameter is set to 'Yes'. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Moderation enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to enable moderation or set to 'No' otherwise. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Name
Base.Description: The name of the distribution group. This specifies the distribution group name in Active Directory Users and Computers and also in the Group Name field in the Exchange Management Console.

Base.Name: Primary SMTP address
Base.Description: Optional value. The primary return SMTP e-mail address for the distribution group. This parameter has meaning only if the distribution group has multiple SMTP e-mail addresses.

Base.Name: Reject messages from
Base.Description: The recipients from whom messages will be rejected. Use for example 'domain.com/Sales/JSmith'. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Reject messages from distribution list members
Base.Description: The distribution lists from which message are rejected. Messages from any member of these distribution lists are rejected. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Reject messages from senders or members
Base.Description: The identity of recipients from whom messages are rejected. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Reject messages from senders or members
Base.Description: The 'Reject messages from senders or members' parameter specifies the identity of recipients from whom messages are rejected.

Base.Name: Report to manager enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to send delivery reports to the distribution group manager, or set to 'No' to disable this feature. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Report to originator enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to send delivery reports to the senders of e-mail messages that are sent to this distribution group, or set to 'No' to disable this feature. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Require sender authentication enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to accept messages only from authenticated senders, or set to 'No' to also accept message from not authenticated senders. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Room list
Base.Description: Optional value. Set to 'Yes' to specify that all members of the distribution group are room resource mailboxes. So it is possible to create a distribution list for an office building in the organization and add all the rooms in that building to the distribution group. When the 'External managed' parameter is set to 'Yes', this parameter cannot be set to 'Yes'. If not specified 'No' is assumed. When enabled, this property cannot be disabled.

Base.Name: SAM Account Name
Base.Description: The name for clients of the object that are running older operating systems. The value is displayed in Active Directory and in the Exchange Management Console in the Group name (pre-Windows 2000) field.

Base.Name: Send moderation notifications
Base.Description: Specify if status modifications are sent to users when they send a message to the moderated dynamic distribution group. Specify one of the following values: 'Always', 'Internal' and 'Never'.

Base.Name: Send oof message to originator enabled
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to allows Out of Office messages to be delivered to the senders of e-mail messages that are sent to this distribution group, set to 'No' to block those messages. If not specified this property will not be changed.

Base.Name: Simple display name
Base.Description: Optional value. The name to display as an alternative description of the object when only a limited set of characters is permitted. This limited set of characters consists of the following characters: abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ0123456789\"()+,-./:?

Base.Explanation: Closes the Exchange session inside the current Powershell session. Use the action Release Powershell Agent service session to subsequently release the Powershell session itself.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Explanation: Release a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session should be previously setup with action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session'. The session is identified by property 'Session ID'.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should correspond with property 'Session ID' of action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session', called previously.
